name: 郭政淳
objective:
引導學生瞭解如何根據不同對象、不同場合、不同時間、不同情境，貼切地使用英語，也概括介紹分析語言溝通所需的概念與工具。
This course is concerned with how speakers organize what they want to say in accordance with who they are talking to, where, when, and under what circumstances. It offers a broad overview of the concepts and tools that are required for analyzing how linguistic communication works.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction
Week 2 Lexical Semantics (I) / Activity #1 Word Senses
Week 3 Lexical Semantics (II) / Activity #2 Vocabulary Learning Resources
Week 4 Compositional Semantics / Activity #3 Compounds and Idioms
Week 5 Group Report (I): English Compounds & Idioms
Week 6 Rules of Conversation / Activity #4 Analyzing Conversation 
Week 7 Drawing Conclusions / Activity #5 Resources for Conversation
Week 8 Speech Acts / Activity #6 Requests & Replies in Classroom 
Week 9 Group Report (II): Classroom Language 
Week 10 Midterm Exam 
Week 11 Politeness / Activity #7 Taboos and Euphemism
Week 12 Honorifics and Other politeness issues
Week 13 Group Report (III): Language and (Im)politeness 
Week 14 Theories of Humor / Activity #8 Humor Genres 
Week 15 Humor Techniques / Activity #9 Humor Analysis
Week 16 Group Report (IV): Analyzing Verbal Humor
Week 17 Use of Language in the Digital Era / Activity #10 Clickbait
Week 18 Group Report (V) / Final Exam
scorePolicy:
In-Class Activities: 25%
Homework: 20%
Group Reports: 25%
Exams: 30%

A total of ten activities will be arranged in class. Each topic will be addressed in lecture (see the schedule below), followed by a worksheet with open-ended questions. Students will discuss in groups and address these questions using personal experience and/or online resources.

Students are required to form groups to report their observations on certain linguistic phenomena. A total of five topics are available (see the schedule below). Each report (opportunity) accounts for 5 pts of the total grade. See individual slide/handout for instructions and requirements for each report.
materials: Reading materials and handouts will be distributed.
